meanings.sent1: The news of the lost toy will sadden the child.
meanings.sent2: The rainy weather can sometimes sadden people.
meanings.sent3: Seeing the sad puppy eyes can easily sadden anyone.
meanings.sent4: The fading sunset colors slowly sadden the sky.
meanings.sent5: The lonely sound of the violin playing can deeply sadden the listener.

meanings.definition: To cause to feel sorrow or grief.
meanings.sent1: The sudden loss of a loved one can deeply sadden a person.
meanings.sent2: The heartbreaking movie scene always manages to sadden me.
meanings.sent3: The melted ice cream cone on a hot day can sadden a child's heart.
meanings.sent4: The wilted flowers in the garden seem to sadden the whole atmosphere.
meanings.sent5: The abandoned puppy's eyes seem to sadden even the toughest of hearts.
